headline: Ukraine Parliament Restricts Russian Books Music
summary: On Sunday, the Ukraine Parliament voted to restrict the broadcasting of Russian music and placed severe restrictions on Russian books. This follows a number of measures aimed at "derussification" that have been enacted in Ukraine both prior and sinceRussia's February 24th invasion of Ukraine.The Ukraine Parliament, also known as the Verkhovna Rada, is specifically calling to ban the playing of music by post-1991 Russian citizens in media and on public transport. Ukrainian-language podcast and music content will be increased on radio and TV broadcasts. At the same time, another bill would prohibit the import of books from Russia and Belarus, and books written by post-1991 Russian citizens could no longer be published or distributed.Both bills received broad support across the Parliament, and are expected to be signed into law by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
